etymologies: mid 16th century: from French amarante or modern Latin amaranthus, alteration (on the pattern of plant names ending in -anthus, from Greek anthos ‘flower’) of Latin amarantus, from Greek amarantos ‘not fading’

definitions: any plant of the genus Amaranthus, typically having small green, red, or purple tinted flowers. Certain varieties are grown for food.

notes.text: Family Amaranthaceae: several genera, especially Amaranthus

shortDefinitions: plant of chiefly tropical family that includes love-lies-bleeding

definitions: an imaginary flower that never fades.
